1function d = dist(w,varargin)
 2%DIST Euclidean distance weight function.
 3%
 4% <a href="matlab:doc dist">dist</a>(P) takes an RxQ matrix P of Q R-element column vectors, and
 5% returns a QxQ matrix of the distances between each of the Q vectors.
 6%
 7% The Euclidean distance between two vectors P(:,i) and P(:,j) is
 8% calculated as D(i,j) = sqrt(sum((P(:,i) - P(:,j)) .^ 2))
 9%
10% For instance, here the distances between 12 neurons arranged in an
11% 4x3 hexagonal grid are calculated.
12%
13%   positions = <a href="matlab:doc hextop">hextop</a>(4,3);
14%   distances = <a href="matlab:doc dist">dist</a>(positions);
15%
16% Here is how to assign this function to define the distances in the same
17% way between the neurons in layer i of a network. Then the neuron's
18% positions and distances can be accessed:
19%
20%  net.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.net_layers">layers</a>{i}.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.layer_topologyFcn">topologyFcn</a> = '<a href="matlab:doc hextop">hextop</a>';
21%  net.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.net_layers">layers</a>{i}.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.layer_distanceFcn">distanceFcn</a> = '<a href="matlab:doc boxdist">boxdist</a>';
22%  net.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.net_layers">layers</a>{i}.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.layer_positions">positions</a>
23%  net.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.net_layers">layers</a>{i}.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.layer_distances">distances</a>
24%
25% Here is how to assign this function to define the distances in the same
26% way between the neurons in layer i of a network. Then the neuron's
27% positions and distances can be accessed:
28%
29%  net.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.net_layers">layers</a>{i}.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.layer_topologyFcn">topologyFcn</a> = '<a href="matlab:doc hextop">hextop</a>';
30%  net.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.net_layers">layers</a>{i}.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.layer_distanceFcn">distanceFcn</a> = '<a href="matlab:doc dist">dist</a>';
31%  net.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.net_layers">layers</a>{i}.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.layer_positions">positions</a>
32%  net.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.net_layers">layers</a>{i}.<a href="matlab:doc nnproperty.layer_distances">distances</a>
33%
34% <a href="matlab:doc dist">dist</a>, like all distance functions, may be used as a weight function.
35%
36% Z = <a href="matlab:doc dist">dist</a>(W,P) takes an SxR weight matrix and RxQ input matrix and
37% returns the SxQ matrix of distances between W's rows and P's columns.
38% <a href="matlab:doc dist">dist</a>(P',P) returns the same result as <a href="matlab:doc dist">dist</a>(P).
39%
40% See <a href="matlab:doc dotprod">dotprod</a> for more information on how weight functions are used.
41%
42% See also BOXDIST, MANDIST, LINKDIST, DOTPROD.
43
44% Mark Beale, 12-15-93
45% Revised 11-31-97, MB
46% Updated by Orlando De Jes�s, Martin Hagan, 7-20-05
47% Copyright 1992-2012 The MathWorks, Inc.
48% $Revision: 1.1.10.6 $  $Date: 2012/03/27 18:12:44 $
49
50% NNET 7.0 Backward Compatibility
51% WARNING - This functionality may be removed in future versions
52if ischar(w)
53  d = nnet7.weight_fcn(mfilename,w,varargin{:});
54  return
55end
56
57% Distance
58if (nargin < 2) || ~isnumeric(varargin{1})
59  d = dist.distance(w,varargin{:});
60else
61  % Apply Weight
62  d = dist.apply(w,varargin{:});
63end
